intro: Oxytropis diantha, commonly known as the pink burro's tail, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its unique, spiny seed pods that resemble a tail. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in sagebrush steppe and desert environments. Oxytropis diantha is adapted to arid conditions and has a deep root system to access water.
